intro: Cocculus domingensis, commonly known as the devil’s backbone, is a climbing vine native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, warty, and often twisted stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by bean-like pods containing dark, glossy seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Due to its unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
